<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Interfering Surge](/Feats.aspx?ID=3032) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 249 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Wellspring Mage](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=104)

**Prerequisites**
[Wellspring Mage Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3029)

**Trigger**
A creature you can see Casts a Spell.

**Requirements**
You have an unexpended spell slot and can see the triggering spell's manifestations.

</column>

---

You overcharge the triggering spell with magic. You expend a spell slot and attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the triggering spell using the energy of the expended slot. If the triggering spell is in your repertoire and the spell slot you expended was a high enough level to cast it, you take no penalty. Otherwise, you take a –2 penalty to the counteract check if the triggering spell was cast using the same magical tradition you cast, or a –5 penalty if it was cast using a different tradition.

 If the triggering spell is successfully counteracted, it creates a [wellspring surge](/Rules.aspx?ID=1580) from its caster in addition to the normal effects of being counteracted. If it isn't counteracted, your expended spell slot creates a wellspring surge from you.

**Special** This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast ([arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), or [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)).
